Posted By: revilolee (10/25/2009 10:22:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
To the guy who said this is outclassed by [Oakenform](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oakenform): you do realize this is an instant, right? Plus, who would use Oakenform when they could use [Elephant Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elephant Guide)... or even better, [Griffin Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griffin Guide) for white?
  
   
As for comparing this with [Vines of Vastwood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vines of Vastwood), it's not entirely fair, since Vines of Vastwood's initial ability is only vs.-opponent shroud, with a boost if the kicker is paid, while this one is just a pure boost for damage, or for saving your creature from damage or toughness-reducing spells. This card can be used in decks that splash green or have green, while Vines would probably be more useful in a mono-green deck.
  
   
Giant Growth was, has been and is the most fair of all the boons.
posts.html:
To the guy who said this is outclassed by Oakenform: you do realize this is an instant, right? Plus, who would use Oakenform when they could use Elephant Guide... or even better, Griffin Guide for white?

As for comparing this with Vines of Vastwood, it's not entirely fair, since Vines of Vastwood's initial ability is only vs.-opponent shroud, with a boost if the kicker is paid, while this one is just a pure boost for damage, or for saving your creature from damage or toughness-reducing spells. This card can be used in decks that splash green or have green, while Vines would probably be more useful in a mono-green deck.

Giant Growth was, has been and is the most fair of all the boons.
